recipes.title: Copycat Bonefish Quinoa Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. One wine you could try is Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions. Cool slightlySteam the edamame according to package instructions, drain, and cool.Toss together the cooked quinoa, steamed edamame, bell pepper, tomatoes, cucumber, and cilantro. Toss so that it is evenly colorful!Squeeze the lemon & lime juice over the salad. Add salt to taste and toss so the juice coats everything.Chill and serve!

steps.step: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions. Cool slightly

Steam the edamame according to package instructions, drain, and cool.Toss together the cooked quinoa, steamed edamame, bell pepper, tomatoes, cucumber, and cilantro. Toss so that it is evenly colorful!Squeeze the lemon & lime juice over the salad.
Add salt to taste and toss so the juice coats everything.Chill and serve!
